long GetBitResolution ( DWORD  BioRadio150 )

Get resolution, in number of bits, of data acquired on fast inputs, according to currently loaded configuration.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Returns:
fast inputs' bit resolution, or no device object at handle (-1)
int GetConfig ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
TBioRadioConfig *  ConfigStruct,
char  PingDevice,
char  DisplayProgressDialog 
)

Get software device object's configuration in TBioRadioConfig struct form. If 'PingDevice' is true, first Ping the device to (re-)populate the device object with the current device configuration.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
ConfigStructreference to TBioRadioConfig configuration structure to populate with current object/device config
PingDevice(boolean) whether to first ping the device for its configuration (acquisition must be started)
DisplayProgressDialog(boolean) whether to display progress dialog during ping
Returns:
success (1), got config from object but couldn't ping (-2), or no device object at handle (-1)
WORD GetEnabledFastInputs ( DWORD  BioRadio150 )

Get enabled state of each fast input in currently loaded configuration. See also GetEnabledSlowInputs(). Use GetNumEnabledFastInputs() to simply get a count of the enabled fast inputs.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Returns:
a 2-byte array of bits, 10 of which correspond to the enabled state of each fast input. Bits 0 (least significant) through 9 correspond to inputs 1 through 10, respectively.
char GetEnabledSlowInputs ( DWORD  BioRadio150 )

Get enabled state of each slow input in currently loaded configuration. See also GetEnabledFastInputs(). Use GetNumEnabledSlowInputs() to simply get a count of the enabled slow inputs.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Returns:
a 1-byte array of bits, 5 of which correspond to the enabled state of each slow input. Bits 0 (least significant) through 4 correspond to Accelerometer X, Accelerometer Y, Body Position, Heart Rate, and SpO2, respectively.
int GetFastSweepsPerPacket ( DWORD  BioRadio150 )

Get the number of times each fast input is sampled for data included in each data acquisition packet. See also GetSlowSweepsPerPacket().

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Returns:
number of fast input sweeps per packet (=10), or no device object at handle (-1)
long GetNumChannels ( DWORD  BioRadio150 )
Deprecated:
use GetNumEnabledInputs(), GetNumEnabledSlowInputs(), or GetNumEnabledFastInputs().
Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Returns:
GetNumEnabledFastInputs()
int GetNumEnabledFastInputs ( DWORD  BioRadio150 )

Get number of enabled fast inputs in currently loaded configuration. See also GetNumEnabledInputs() and GetNumEnabledSlowInputs(). Use GetEnabledFastInputs() to see exactly which of the fast inputs are enabled.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Returns:
number of enabled fast inputs (max 10: Inputs 1-10), or no device object at handle (-1)
int GetNumEnabledInputs ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
int *  FastMainInputs,
int *  FastAuxInputs,
int *  SlowAuxInputs 
)

Get number of enabled inputs in currently loaded configuration.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
FastMainInputsnumber of enabled Fast Main Inputs (max 8: Inputs 1-8)
FastAuxInputsnumber of enabled Fast Auxiliary Inputs (max 2: Inputs 9-10)
SlowAuxInputsnumber of enabled Slow Auxiliary Inputs (max 5: Accelerometer X, Accelerometer Y, Body Position, Heart Rate, SpO2)
Returns:
total number of inputs (max 15), or no device object at handle (-1)
int GetNumEnabledSlowInputs ( DWORD  BioRadio150 )

Get number of enabled slow inputs in currently loaded configuration. See also GetNumEnabledInputs() and GetNumEnabledFastInputs(). Use GetEnabledSlowInputs() to see exactly which of the slow inputs are enabled.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Returns:
number of enabled slow inputs (max 5: Accelerometer X, Accelerometer Y, Body Position, Heart Rate, SpO2), or no device object at handle (-1)
long GetSampleRate ( DWORD  BioRadio150 )

Get rate at which data is being acquired, in samples per second, according to currently loaded configuration.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Returns:
sample rate, or no device object at handle (-1)
int GetSlowSweepsPerPacket ( DWORD  BioRadio150 )

Get the number of times each slow input is sampled for data included in each data acquisition packet. See also GetFastSweepsPerPacket().

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Returns:
number of slow input sweeps per packet (=1), or no device object at handle (-1)
int LoadConfig ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
char *  Filename 
)

Load from file a device configuration, and apply it to device object, (but do not program device.)

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Filenamecomplete path to configuration file as null-terminated C-string
Returns:
success (1) or failure (not 1)
int PingConfig ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
char  DisplayProgressDialog 
)

Acquire current configuration from User Unit and populate device object. Acquisition must be started.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
DisplayProgressDialog(boolean) whether to display progress dialog during ping
Returns:
success (1) or failure (not 1)
int ProgramConfig ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
char  DisplayProgressDialog,
const char *  Filename 
)

Program the User Unit with the specified configuration. Acquisition must be started.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
DisplayProgressDialog(boolean) whether to display progress dialog during program
Filenamecomplete path to configuration file as null-terminated C-string
Returns:
success (1) or failure (not 1)
int SaveConfig ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
char *  Filename 
)

Save to file the software device object's current configuration in the (not necessarily the device's current configuration.)

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Filenamecomplete path to configuration file as null-terminated C-string
Returns:
success (1) or failure (not 1)
int SetConfig ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
TBioRadioConfig *  ConfigStruct,
char  ProgramDevice,
char  DisplayProgressDialog 
)

Set the software device object's configuration from (TBioRadioConfig) struct. If 'ProgramDevice' is true, program the device with the new configuration.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
ConfigStructreference to TBioRadioConfig configuration structure to which to set and (optionally) program
ProgramDevice(boolean) whether to program the new configuration to the device (acquisition must be started)
DisplayProgressDialog(boolean) whether to display progress dialog during program
Returns:
success (1), set config from struct but couldn't program (-2), or no device object at handle (-1)
